_88MakerJs.IPoint.description:
An x-y point in a two-dimensional space.
Implemented as an array with 2 elements. The first element is x, the second element is y.

Examples:
```
var p: IPoint = [0, 0];   //typescript
var p = [0, 0];   //javascript
```

_88MakerJs.IPathArc.description:
An arc path.

Examples:
```
var arc: IPathArc = { type: 'arc', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7, startAngle: 0, endAngle: 45 };   //typescript
var arc = { type: 'arc', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7, startAngle: 0, endAngle: 45 };   //javascript
```

___endAngle.description: The angle (in degrees) to end drawing the arc, in polar (counter-clockwise) direction. May be less than start angle if it past 360.

$eref.description:
An x-y point in a two-dimensional space.
Implemented as an array with 2 elements. The first element is x, the second element is y.

Examples:
```
var p: IPoint = [0, 0];   //typescript
var p = [0, 0];   //javascript
```

___origin.description: The main point of reference for this path.

___type.description: The type of the path, e.g. "line", "circle", or "arc". These strings are enumerated in pathType.

___startAngle.description: The angle (in degrees) to begin drawing the arc, in polar (counter-clockwise) direction.

___units.description: Optional unit system of this model. See UnitType for possible values.

___origin.description: Optional origin location of this model.

___type.description: A model may want to specify its type, but this value is not employed yet.

___models.description: Optional array of models within this model.

___paths.description: Optional array of path objects in this model.

___notes.description: An author may wish to add notes to this model instance.

___exporterOptions.description: Optional exporter options for this model.

$eref.description: A line, curved line or other simple two dimensional shape.

___origin.description: The main point of reference for this path.

___type.description: The type of the path, e.g. "line", "circle", or "arc". These strings are enumerated in pathType.

$eref.description:
A line path.

Examples:
```
var line: IPathLine = { type: 'line', origin: [0, 0], end: [1, 1] };   //typescript
var line = { type: 'line', origin: [0, 0], end: [1, 1] };   //javascript
```

___origin.description: The main point of reference for this path.

___type.description: The type of the path, e.g. "line", "circle", or "arc". These strings are enumerated in pathType.

___end.description: The end point defining the line. The start point is the origin.

$eref.description:
A circle path.

Examples:
```
var circle: IPathCircle = { type: 'circle', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7 };   //typescript
var circle = { type: 'circle', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7 };   //javascript
```

___origin.description: The main point of reference for this path.

___type.description: The type of the path, e.g. "line", "circle", or "arc". These strings are enumerated in pathType.

$eref.description:
An arc path.

Examples:
```
var arc: IPathArc = { type: 'arc', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7, startAngle: 0, endAngle: 45 };   //typescript
var arc = { type: 'arc', origin: [0, 0], radius: 7, startAngle: 0, endAngle: 45 };   //javascript
```

___endAngle.description: The angle (in degrees) to end drawing the arc, in polar (counter-clockwise) direction. May be less than start angle if it past 360.

___origin.description: The main point of reference for this path.

___type.description: The type of the path, e.g. "line", "circle", or "arc". These strings are enumerated in pathType.

___startAngle.description: The angle (in degrees) to begin drawing the arc, in polar (counter-clockwise) direction.

